attributes.action: Treat male and female victims of domestic and sexual violence equally.
attributes.background: The UK government sees domestic and sexual abuse as a gender issue. £50 million + is spent funding services for female victims. Nothing is spent on male victims.1/3 of all victims are male. 1 in 6 men experience abuse. The government needs a minister for men and boys, there is a minister for women.
attributes.additional_details: Research suggests 1 in 6 men experience some form of abuse. 30 men each year are killed. No government funding is provided to any service for male victims of domestic abuse, some money is given to the men's advice line. There are approx 10 000 refuge beds specifically for women, there are around 20 for men. 2 out of every 5 victims are male 40% men need 40% of the budget allocated to services to fund refuge beds, outreach support etc. This is not a gender issue this is about victims not gender.

attributes.action: Create a free fast-track citizenship programme for current resident EU citizens
attributes.background: This petition calls on Parliament to create a fast-track citizenship programme at no cost for all non-native EU citizens who wish to remain in the UK following our exit from the EU.

attributes.action: Lift EU/US sanctions on Russia to increase trade now the UK is leaving the EU
attributes.background: As the UK has chosen to exit the EU, we will be no longer bound by US-influenced, EU sanctions on Russia. We should lift sanctions on Russia as an independent country to regain the millions of pounds of trade we have lost with Russia. We don't need to participate in EU/US sanctions against Russia.
attributes.additional_details: The EU and the US introduced sanctions on Russia over the democratic decision of the people of Crimea to reunify with Russia and Russia's alleged backing of separatists in Eastern Ukraine. The UK had to participate in this as an EU member. Now the UK is leaving the EU, we need not be dictated to by it. Lost trade with Russia costs the UK many millions of pounds. This is trade that we are now at liberty to get back. Russia is a market of 140m consumers British business needs.

attributes.action: Manchester & other pro-EU cities to become independent EU member city states
attributes.background:
Manchester, Liverpool, Leeds, London, etc... We didnt vote to leave the EU. We want to protections that EU membership offers in terms of workers rights, human rights, and environmental legislation. 
We want to secede from the UK & remain in the EU, operating as a network of independent city states.
attributes.additional_details:
The cities that voted to remain in the EU have a long history of welcoming migrants and of fighting for progressive values. We want to continue to enjoy the benefits of EU membership whilst also fighting for a better Europe. 

With devolution already on the agenda, our cities could operate as networked city-states with EU membership. We should hold local referenda on seceding from the UK and remaining in the EU.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for cyclists to use cycle paths where provided
attributes.background: Cycle paths are created and funded for one sole reason, safety to cyclists and motorists, where provided it should be a legal requirement for cyclists to use the cycle paths to reduce danger to them and motorists on UK roads, especially those which are 60mph speed limits.

attributes.action: Erect a statue of Jo Cox in Parliament Square.
attributes.background: Jo Cox was brutally murdered at her constituency surgery.  Jo was a well loved and respected campaigner and MP who always stood up for others.  Parliament Square has 11 statues, none of women.

attributes.action:
If the UK votes leave and London votes IN,
London should become Independent.
attributes.background: Polls suggest that London will vote in favour of remaining in the EU. Scotland is already planning to leave Great Britain in order to remain in the EU, if Britain votes to leave. London should have the opportunity to do the same. Its population is larger than many EU states.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.standard.co.uk/news/london/eu-referendum-london-backs-remain-vote-poll-shows-a3256001.html

attributes.action: Introduce Automatic Voter Registration in the UK
attributes.background: In the past few days, people have struggled to register to vote at the 'last minute' - an hour before closing. Every citizen over 18 has the right to do so. We should not be putting an arbitrary barrier in the way and should be making it as easy as possible to register to vote.
attributes.additional_details:
When signing up for a driving licence, we are asked if we would like to join the organ donor register - most 17 year old are asked the question. They could also be provisionally registered to vote at this time with an 'opt out' clause here.
Registration for further licences, e.g. HGVs, could prompt the same option.
Interaction with other government agencies could offer scope for a similar opt out option arrangement - e.g. student loans, pensions, benefits, HMRC

attributes.action: Pass law to impound vehicles/caravans of travellers who damage public land.
attributes.background: Recently a travellers community has twice descended on our village, and twice been rapidly evicted by the local Council. The travellers, who act with a wholesome contempt for the law, have twice caused an indescribable and costly mess. This is a UK-wide problem. It's time to stop to this behaviour.
attributes.additional_details: If a group of travellers dumps vast quantities of bulk rubbish and human waste while they occupy public land, it costs tax payers' money to clean up. In these circumstances, the group's behaviour forfeits their right to live in this way. If they knew they could lose their vehicles/caravans, maybe they would behave differently. It's time to put a stop to this anti-social behaviour. Sign the petition and let's get our MPs to raise this issue in a Parliamentary debate!”

attributes.action: No assessments for DLA recipients when changing to PIP
attributes.background:
For people with long term disabilities that will not get better

If you have lost limbs, or an invisible disabilities such as Dyspraxia, Autism, or any disability that will never get better. ( There are loads of examples I could mention) You should not have to be reassessed for PIP.

attributes.action: Bring back Dartford crossing barriers to even out traffic flow.
attributes.background: Bring back Dartford crossing barriers to limit the amount of traffic going into the tunnel or on the bridge at once. This could help to reduce accidents also.
attributes.additional_details: The fines are not being spent well enough if they have to be in place! Use this money to help improve our traffic flow!

attributes.action: Make adult adoption legal in the UK
attributes.background: Many people today do not live in traditional nuclear families; and many children form a stronger bond with a step-parent or relationship with someone of a similar nature as opposed to a biological parent.
attributes.additional_details:
It seems, for many reasons, children and their potential adopters don't get the opportunity to discuss and/or execute adoption until the child has reached legal adulthood; and by this point the UK government no longer views the said child as eligible for adoption.
The implications of this are social and legal issues that arise later in life surrounding the relationship between child and, for example, step-parent.
I believe the 2002 UK Adoption and Children Act is outdated for modern day Britain.

attributes.action: Stop energy companies having the ablity to report to credit reference agencies.
attributes.background:
Companies like Npower have received over 2 million complaints from customers, with a wide range of problems and disputes.

Npower has already been fined 26 million pound.

Once you get into a dispute with the likes of npower they have the power to put bad credit marks within your credit file.
attributes.additional_details:
Npower have had huge problems with there IT systems and customer service levels, customers have been billed in error and many of there customers are subjected to harassment and receive default notices within there credit files through the mismanagement of how npower manager there customers accounts.

Complaints are received on a daily basics and npower are still not being held accountable.

My full story can been seen at http://www.npowercomplaints.uk

attributes.action: Have schools teach children the signs of domestic abuse, physical & emotional.
attributes.background: There are too many people who are being abused in their home and we need to make people including young children who may be victims of it aware of the signs so they can go for help if they need to. It will help reduce the amount of deaths each year which go unnoticed.
attributes.additional_details: There are many helpline such as Rising Sun but we need to make sure children and even adults are aware of this as well as aware of the tell tale signs that someone is a victim of abuse, or that they may be a victim.

attributes.action: Take Military Action against ISIL both here in the UK and abroad.
attributes.background: In light of the recent terrorist attacks in France and Germany, I would call upon the UK Government to take Military Action against ISIL both here in Britain and Abroad.

attributes.action: Stop road resurfacing with tar and chippings
attributes.background: Stop resurfacing roads using tar and chippings, it is extrememly dangerous for cyclists and motorbike riders and can also damage car paint work (even when the 20mph limit is adhered too) not to mention the herrendous mess which it can cause when the stones are carried hundreds of meteres away.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for disabled toilets to be used as storage
attributes.background:
In the news 18th July 2016 eurostar were using disabled toilets for push bikes , this is not unusual in the few months I've found two pubs I'm my local area using their disabled toilet as storage for high chairs .
Disabled toilets are for easy access  not storage.
attributes.additional_details: Eurostar storing bikes in disabled toilets - http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-36820751

attributes.action: Hold a referendum to determine what alternative to EU membership the UK wants.
attributes.background: After being given the choice of remaining or leaving the EU in the recent referendum, it is only proper that the people of the UK should have the right to choose what type of relationship they want with the EU so that the government has better guidance in its negotiations.
attributes.additional_details:
The main alternatives to membership in the EU are set out in the Cabinet Office's policy paper "Alternatives to membership: possible models for the United Kingdom outside the European Union, dated 2 March 2016.  Remaining in the EU should be one of the choices in case people do not like the alternatives.  The choices should be:

1) Be a member of the European Economic Area
2) Negotiate a bilateral agreement with the EU
3) Be a member of the World Trade Organisation
4) Remain a member of the EU

attributes.action: Introduce mandatory standards for how MPs communicate with their constituents.
attributes.background: Once an MP is elected, they can ignore their Constituents’ wishes.  Constituents must wait five years before they can do anything about this.  MPs can even ignore Disabled Constituents, or refuse to have email addresses etc. for people to contact them.
attributes.additional_details:
MPs should be required to:-
1)  make contacting them accessible for everyone; and
2)  adhere to basic equality standards.

attributes.action: To limit fireworks to organised, licenced events before 9 at night.
attributes.background: I feel that nervous animals, the elderly and young children suffer when fireworks are set off at all hours on any day. 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, 10 and 1  o clock in the morning last night for example.
attributes.additional_details: One of my dogs who had had dental surgery began to bleed again due to her being stressed..repeatedly. People who have to get up early,  young children and the elderly cannot sleep. I'm a nurse who has witnessed elderly dementia patients think they're back in world war 2 because the loud bangs remind them of bombs going off. At least if fireworks were limited to set days and times we could prepare for it better. You can't give animals calming medication continually just in case.

attributes.action: Keep the army bound by the European Convention on Human Rights during conflict.
attributes.background: In her conference speech, Theresa May declared that the army would have an opt-out of the European Convention on Human Rights (ECHR) during conflict. This means, in effect, that the army would have a free hand to violate basic human rights such as freedom from torture and the right to a fair trial.
attributes.additional_details: The ECHR is an international treaty, drafted in 1950 and championed by British governments ever since. It sets out a series of fundamental rights that governments are bound to respect. This Convention was signed and ratified by the British government in the aftermath of the WWII to ensure that the human rights violations during this conflict would not happen again. For more information on the rights that the ECHR protects, visit: www.echr.coe.int/Documents/Convention_ENG.pdf

attributes.action: Make putting an offer on a house purchase in England legally binding.
attributes.background: Far too many people are being let down and are also suffering unnecessary costs from the fact that people can put an offer on a house they want to buy and then withdraw at any point before exchange without penalty.
attributes.additional_details: Buying and selling houses is such a life changing and costly process it should not be subject to people changing their minds in a whim.  Many families can suffer heartache when a house chain collapses due to a person simply changing their mind.  I propose that before people enter a bid on a house they should get a survey and any searches competed and be in a position to pay a deposit.   This would add an a strong element of security to the house buying and selling process.

attributes.action: Make schools relax their uniform policies
attributes.background: Schools are turning pupils away due to uniform violations which disrupts a child's education. Schools should be made to relax these draconian policies. A parent is fined for taking their child out in term time, yet schools openly send children home. Clothing does not have a bearing on education!
attributes.additional_details:
Why do schools think it's ok to disrupt a child's education in this way? This denies children the education they are entitled to. The strict uniform policies are often discriminatory and unfair, if not petty.
School uniforms are a part of school life, this is accepted, but why does the 'wrong colour' black shoe or wrong type of material matter?  A child's education should matter more than the cut of their clothing. Make schools relax their policies to ensure all children are treated fairly!

attributes.action: For the NHS to fund mTOR inhibitor and for free.
attributes.background: It will help those with TSC, will help with the facial rash that develops during the course of childhood, and will clear the rash up that is caused by TSC.
attributes.additional_details: Letters from NHS,Queen,Prime minister, and department of health.

attributes.action: Take action to break the siege in Aleppo and enforce a no bombing zone.
attributes.background: Send a message to the people of Aleppo to say that we are listening and we are taking action. We will apply pressure on our government to do more.
attributes.additional_details:
Dr. Hatem, Director of the Aleppo Children’s Hospital run by the Independent Doctor’s Association (IDA): 
"We need the international community. And that means pressure from you. Tell your government, tell the UN, tell every international institution that the world can still break the siege and stop the bombs. Please, save us. Save Aleppo."

attributes.action: Make umbilical/placental donation available to mothers all over the UK.
attributes.background: I have 2 children, Jack (17 months), and Alfred who is 5 weeks old.I looked into umbilical donation when I was having Alfie. I was disappointed when I realised this service is only available in 4 hospitals in the UK and therefore would not be an option to me! What a waste of life saving stem cells!
attributes.additional_details: Cord blood and stem cells are used to repair damaged tissue, regrow and replace worn out organs and cure life threatening illnesses, yet umbilical donation is only available in 4 hospitals throughout the UK. Hundreds of thousands umbilical cords and placentas are simply binned and destroyed every year.

attributes.action: Make an allowance for children with social challenges to have term time holiday
attributes.background: Children on the autistic spectrum for instance can find being around others difficult, it can be overwhelming and make them very uncomfortable. They often need more space and time to adjust and process and they ought to have the opportunity for a relaxing holiday, like any one else.
attributes.additional_details: Term time holidays would allow for a quieter environment, more physical and mental space, slower / calmer interactions with people, less stress caused by social situations, less queuing, less waiting, a break from peers, the result being a calmer and more relaxed child and therefore family.

attributes.action: Create a system in which breached child contact orders can be enforced quickly
attributes.background: Parents are being ripped away from their children for months after a separation while they await a court hearing. They spend thousands to get a court order which, if breached, has to be brought to court to be enforced. The wronged parent incurs all costs and is again seperated from his/her children.
attributes.additional_details: The parent breaching the court order is breaking the law yet it is the other parent, and the children, who suffer. It can take 4 months to get a date for the original order to be enforced which is unacceptable. The parent breaching the court order should be forced to pay all costs and this process should take a maximum of, for example, 30 days. This will minimise the emotional impact on the children and parents whilst reducing the occurance of breached orders.

attributes.action: The independent election of the director general of the BBC.
attributes.background: There are numerous cases recently where the journalistic integrity and neutrality of the British Broadcasting Corporation has come into question.  The neutrality of the BBC is essential in order for the British people to make informed decisions regarding Politics in the United Kingdom.

attributes.action: Permit a one off national holiday celebrating immigrants and their contributions
attributes.background: In light of recent doubts raised across multiple spectrums about the benefits of immigration we believe it is time for immigrants to reveal their true value the country. By staging a single one off strike/national holiday the impact of the U.K. without immigrants might be better understood.

attributes.action: Divert the £4,000,000 spent on Homeopathy to a Mental Health Awareness Campaign.
attributes.background: Every year, the NHS spends around £4 to £5 million on Homeopathy, a remedial pratice which has been repeatedly examined and found to have no long term health benefit other than placebo. This money could find better use as a national mental health awareness campaign to help curtail MH stigmatisation.
attributes.additional_details:
A 2010 review into homeopathy found that it was a 'placebo treatment'.
http://www.parliament.uk/business/committees/committees-archive/science-technology/s-t-homeopathy-inquiry/

This is an example of a mental health campaign which could be better funded with the extra money available from ceasing to fund homeopathy.
http://www.time-to-change.org.uk/

attributes.action: Prior to invoking Article 50 UK Gov should renegotiate EU reform & hold 2nd Ref
attributes.background: The UK Gov to work alongside EU Gov's & the EU Comm to Reform EU Treaties prior to invoking Article 50 and then put a second IN/OUT Referendum to the UK electorate on the basis of delivering material change since the 1st Referendum. This is the pragmatic way forward and will keep the Union intact.
attributes.additional_details: It is clear that the UK OUT vote has sent shock waves across Europe and that the Euro Politicians are now coming to terms that they will need to be open to renegotiation and reform whereas previously they were complacent & intransient particularly as they face similar Eurosceptism and calls for similar IN/OUT referendums from their own electorate as things stand. It is time for Europe to reform and it is time for the UK to lead these discussions now that the European elite are in listening mode.

attributes.action: Replace subsidies for green energy (FITs)  with a loan guarantee scheme.
attributes.background:
Producing green energy has become more viable as cost of deployment has reduced drastically (IRENA).
Loan guarantees would enable more schemes to be built than subsidies (FITs) and could potentially negate the need for the nuclear plant at Hinkley whilst contributing towards environmental targets.
attributes.additional_details:
Government subsidies (FITs) for medium/large scale green energy schemes have been reduced.  
New schemes face difficulty in raising finance because lenders are unable to analyse the risk/reward the sector represents.  
Finance contributes to the 25 Giga Watts held up and awaiting deployment (DECC April 2016).  
A rolling scheme of up to £5 billion could replace the need for Hinkley Point C to be built providing 3200+ MW of green energy.
Example:  www.greensaturn.com/content/pages/renewablesnothinkley

attributes.action: Only one councillor should represent a ward in the local councils.
attributes.background: Derbyshire PCC Mr Hardayal Dhindsa is a local councillor as well. PCC role is quite demanding and a full time position, still Mr Dhindsa decided to continue as a Councillor. This shows that three councillors aren't needed to represent a ward specially when in Sandwell 71 out of 72 are from Labour.
attributes.additional_details: In Derby there are total of 17 wards and every ward has 3 councillors. Interestingly if all three are from the same party then it becomes quite pointless to have them. There is no job description and position doesn't have any accountability. One tory councillor kept on getting paid while he lived abroad. Also councils like Sandwell only have Labour councillors and that has been the case for ages. Local democracy is failing and need urgent reforms.

attributes.action: Restore Capital punishment for terrorists & killers of our police & Armed Forces
attributes.background:
Capital Punishment was abolished in 1969.
and for treason was abolished in 1998
With the ever increasing global threat from terrorism, now is the time to restore Capital punishment
Those who seek to murder by terrorism or kill our armed forces and police should pay the ultimate price
attributes.additional_details:
With the heinous murder of Lee Rigby by terrorists, it showed how great the threat to our country really was.
Those who would seek to murder our citizens, Armed Forces and police should face the ultimate sanction.
Furthermore, there is now a fresh threat to our shores from Irish terrorists.
It is time that Capital punishment for the offences of terrorism, murder of Armed Forces and police was brought back on to the statute books.
The evil cowards who cause death and destruction deserve no less

attributes.action: Extend sentencing powers to allow the use of lifetime bans from driving.
attributes.background: Many motorists obey the law till they get behind a steering wheel. They don't ever think of going to jail but would relate more to the possibility of being banned from driving for life. Such bans would be at the judge's discretion and only used for repeated bad driving or the most heinous incidents.
attributes.additional_details:
The kinds of cases I am thinking about include repeated use of mobile phones and repeated cases of drink- or drug-driving resulting in injury/death, or killing/injuring someone while driving at more than 20 per cent over a speed limit. 

While a long jail sentence is not always good for society, a short sentence and lifetime ban would emphasise the seriousness of an offence and give victims/relatives a stronger impression that justice had been done. Jail would be an option for breaches of a ban.

attributes.action: Free public travel for NHS nurses
attributes.background: NHS nurses recieve an extremely small wage and the cost of almost daily public travel can be very expensive

attributes.action: Request that the government revoke Govia's contract for Southern Rail
attributes.background:
Southern Rail customers are fed up with the continued poor service -cancelled trains, late trains, trains will less cars than normal, poor compensation.
This is also starting to affect employees and employers when people are continually late or need to leave early

attributes.action: Make all technical sporting goods in the UK tax free to encourage participation
attributes.background: Cycling has increased in popularity immensely since the success of the 2012 Olympics and due to the Government's cycle to work scheme allowing tax free purchasing of cycle equipment. I would like to see all technical sporting goods to be tax free to encourage more people to take up sport in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: The Olympic success in 2012 and 2016 has shown that the UK has the ability to be a great sporting nation. We should encourage more sporting participation and a healthier lifestyle by allowing tax free purchases on all technical sporting goods and not just for those in full time employment. Clothing would be exempt but hardware would be tax free. E.G bicycles, helmets, running trainers, weight training equipment, trekking poles, climbing equipment etc anything which encourages sporting activity.

attributes.action: Lowering the state pension age for women born in the 50s back to 60 years old.
attributes.background: My mother was born on the 10th december 1953, if she was born 4 days earlier she would have retired 2 and half years ago. I'm sure a lot of the country is in the same situation. There wasn't enough time for people born in the 50s to save. This needs to change back to the state pension age of 60.

attributes.action: Stop organisations from charging more for not making payment by Direct Debit.
attributes.background: Direct debit gives a third party open access to your wallet and bank account at any time and at will. Those who pay by other LEGAL methods are penalized with higher fees. In effect its a stealth tax charged by companies who want easy access to YOUR money. Its not right, Its not moral and its unjust.
attributes.additional_details:
If funds are not available or a payments going into account are not there on time due to bank errors or delays in employee payments or benefit payments it can cause LIFE THREATENING problems for those on a low budget as bank fees are taken from allowances put aside for food or essentials. This puts incredible pressure those on a tight budget who are hit the most with unrealistic fees for returned direct debits forcing them into further debt.

This is immoral for modern day British Companies.

attributes.action: Change the legislation, so that Non Binary people are recognised under the law
attributes.background: Currently, the only genders recognised under the law are 'Male' and 'Female'. This makes people who do not identify as either gender uncomfortable and is discrimative. Please change this legislation.
attributes.additional_details: It has emerged, in the recent report, allowing Transgender people to change their gender, on their passport, without a medical certificate. This is a big step, but there's much further to go. The 'X' box gender should be allowed, and therefore this legislation should be changed, recognising all gender identities, be that to one, all or no genders. Everyone is valid and deserves to be represented.

attributes.action: Re enact the 1955 canal closure act of parliament.
attributes.background: The Northern reaches of the Lancaster canal were cut off from the main line in 1968.To make way for the M6 motorway,the Locks were de commissioned and the canal was severed in several locations.We propose restoration by stages,to encourage New businesses ,especially tourism.
attributes.additional_details: We have support from numerous boating ,restoration societies.And over 500 members of our group.OWD LANKY BOATERS.Both parish and county councils have show support also.

attributes.action: Support the provision of new bomb detection equipment to Baghdad checkpoints.
attributes.background: On the 2nd of July, 165 innocent Iraqis were killed in the Karrada district of Baghdad in a massive explosion near a shopping mall by car bomb- a truck to be precise.  Another car bomb explosion took the lives of around 100 innocent shoppers at a market in Baghdad a month before. The list is long.
attributes.additional_details: There are many Checkpoints in Baghdad. Police are still using fake bomb detectors bought via a bogus British businessman who was jailed in the UK over the deal 3 years ago. Iraqi Prime minister called for an end to their use. It is frustrating to see that so many innocent lives could be saved using modern security technologies, which the UK is a world leader in. I call on the British government to openly support the Iraqi authority in replacing bomb detection equipment at checkpoints.

attributes.action: Introduce better regulation for Online & Print Media
attributes.background:
The public rely heavily on media to inform them of the news and make many decisions based on it. It is often biased, incites hate and manipulates people.

This is often evident by reading a number of newspapers, all of which have conflicting articles against each other.

attributes.action: The UK should not leave the EU until all devolved assemblies of the UK agree.
attributes.background: The non-binding EU referendum has shown a simple majority for the 'leave the EU' option. However the results represent the majority view of the English and Welsh but not of voters in Scotland, Northern Ireland and London. It would undemocractic to force this result on the UK as a whole.
attributes.additional_details: The vote has not produced a clear mandate from the whole of the United Kingdom. There is now a very real risk of the UK disintegrating if this vote is simply seen as a mandate to remove the UK from the EU. The Government may accept the the result as advisory, but should now discuss will all devolved assemblies and with the EU as to a means of obtaining a compromise on the views expressed by this divided nation.

attributes.action: Protect our marine and terrestrial environment after brexit
attributes.background: The UK was bound under EU law to protect the marine and terrestrial environment, this could be threatened due to the referendum. The Water Framework Directive, Habitat Directive, Marine Litter Directive and Bird Directive, all protected these environments. It is important we still follow these.
attributes.additional_details:
These Directives actively reduce pollution, monitor it and help reduce. At the same time it protects wildlife, it would be a backward step for the UK not to monitor and actively take part in these directives. The environment is something we should all treasure and it does not respect boundaries as we do. We must work with the EU to make this work even though we have voted out. 
It is important that fishing quotas remain to protect the future of our fish and seas, or soon there will be no fish.

attributes.action: To require a two-thirds majority vote for all referendums in the United Kingdom.
attributes.background:
A referendum on a national level is meant to be a means for parliament to secure popular consent on issues that leave government divided, or when there is special need for a vote of public support.

This cannot be done when important constitutional changes are decided with a 1-5% majority.
attributes.additional_details:
With turnout in referendums generally falling, the UK needs to adapt it's rules according to voting so that two-thirds majority is required. The UK needs to factor in the fact that turnout will never be 100%, and that 51% of anything less than that is not an actual majority.

A two-thirds majority vote would secure popular consent on every level referendums are held, ensuring that government would have a genuine majority to grant the decision legitimacy regardless of voter turnout.

attributes.action: All NHS trusts should provide dual diagnosis treatment
attributes.background:
When mental health problems and substance misuse co-exist, this is known as a dual diagnosis. 22-44% of all adult inpatients in England also have a substance misuse problem and 22% of all suicides are linked to alcohol use.

Why are so many people falling through the net?
attributes.additional_details:
Many NHS trusts simply refuse to make a mental health diagnosis if the individual is under the influence of alcohol.  Without an assessment, an appropriate referral cannot be made and treatment cannot be given, leaving the individual to continue self-medicating while their physical and mental health deteriorates. 

Sectioning or suicide shouldn't be the only options left. 

Early intervention is vital. More funding is needed. More training. More communication. More person-centred treatment.

attributes.action: No appeals for deportation of illegal immigrants and failed asylum seekers
attributes.background: Too many illegals abscond whilst their appeal is being considered UK Border Force should have the power to remove illegal immigrants
